stimulusHtml: Which of the following best explains why an error occurs when the classes are compiled?

features.html:
Consider the following class definitions. 

 

public class Measurement
{
   private int feet;
   private int inches;

   public Measurement(int numFeet, int numInches)  
   {
      feet = numFeet;
      inches = numInches;
   }

  private int toInches()
  {
     return feet * 12 + inches;
  }
}

 

public class Calculations
{
   public static boolean compare(Measurement m1, Measurement m2)
   {
      if (m1.toInches() >= m2.toInches())
      {
         return true;
      }
      return false;
   }
}

choicesHtml: The compare method cannot have parameters of type Measurement.
The compare method should be declared as void.
The toInches method cannot be accessed from a class other than Measurement.
The variables feet and inches cannot be accessed from the method toInches.
